body:
What in you opinion was the biggest change Avicus has seen?
For example: the removal of the throwback rotation, as I believe this had the biggest change for me, how now I would need to deal with newer maps, which I did not know as well :D
body_tagged:
What in you opinion was the biggest change Avicus has seen?
For example: the removal of the throwback rotation, as I believe this had the biggest change for me, how now I would need to deal with newer maps, which I did not know as well :D
title: What was the biggest change for Avicus?

replies.body: not only throwback but the whole atlas update
replies.body_tagged: not only throwback but the whole atlas update

replies.body: The change from McZone to Avicus was probably the biggest one, but also the Avicore update was big, because a lot of players instantly stopped playing and since then the player count kept decreasing.
replies.body_tagged: The change from McZone to Avicus was probably the biggest one, but also the Avicore update was big, because a lot of players instantly stopped playing and since then the player count kept decreasing.

Inloc winning a tourney.

ytilauxesomoh

replies.body:
Not migrating server ips from MCZone to Avicus was literally THE reason why Avicus initially lost so many players.

Player loss just snowballed from there, but that was the beginning of it.
replies.body_tagged:
Not migrating server ips from MCZone to Avicus was literally THE reason why Avicus initially lost so many players.

Player loss just snowballed from there, but that was the beginning of it.

replies.body:
i dont even understand why would they migrate from mczone to avicus i nthe first place
mczone was a huge successful server and was by no means dying, i dont see the reason for a big change which fucked the entire playercount gg

replies.body: The biggest change was cellish being banned

i dont think they even are
